title: Reggae Music
description: Reggae emerged in Jamaica in the late 1960s, blending ska, rocksteady, and African rhythms. It became a global voice for resistance, peace, and Rastafari philosophy.

title: Jamaican Cuisine
description: Jamaican food is a fusion of African, Indigenous, and colonial influences. Dishes like jerk chicken, ackee and saltfish, and callaloo reflect deep cultural roots and local ingredients.

title: Rastafari
description: Rastafari is a spiritual movement rooted in resistance to oppression and reverence for African heritage. It emphasizes unity, natural living, and the divinity of Haile Selassie I.

title: Maroon Heritage
description: The Maroons are descendants of enslaved Africans who escaped and formed independent communities. They preserved African traditions and negotiated autonomy from colonial powers.

title: Dancehall Culture
description: Dancehall evolved from reggae, emphasizing rhythm, performance, and social commentary. Itâ€™s a vibrant space for fashion, identity, and community expression.
